newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNLINES BUYS NEW VESSELS FOR $160 MLN.
newsitem.headline: FINNLINES BUYS NEW VESSELS FOR $160 MLN.

text.p: Finnish shipping company Finnlines Oy said on Wednesday it had bought two new ro-ro vessels from Swedish Stena AB for about $160 million.
"The purchase price is about $80 million per vessel and Stena Ferries Ltd will finance the construction," Finnlines said in a statement.
Finnlines will finance the investment partly in cash and partly with borrowed funds, it said.
Both RoPax (ro-ro-passenger) vessels have cargo capacities of 2,500 lane metres, expandable to 3,000 lane metres, and passenger capacities of 440 beds, which can be doubled, Finnlines said.
The vessels are under construction at the AESA Puerto Real shipyard in Spain, and will delivered to start operating on Finnlines Helsinki-Lubeck route in the second tertial of 1998, Finnlines said.
It said it also plans to increase the cargo and passenger capacity of the four combi-roro vessels it now operates on the Helsinki-Lubeck route, but it did not give a value for that investment.
"The investment is assumed to have a positive influence already on the 1998 result," it said.
